meanings.definition: To appoint or assign as a deputy.
meanings.sent1: The manager will deputise John to lead the team while he is away.
meanings.sent2: She was asked to deputise for her colleague at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: In a funny twist, the cat decided to deputise the dog as its deputy for the day.
meanings.sent4: The sun can deputise the moon in lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The superhero deputised her sidekick to protect the city in her absence.

meanings.definition: To act as a deputy or substitute for someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the event, Sarah will deputise for the main speaker if needed.
meanings.sent2: He often deputises for his boss when she is on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The clown decided to deputise for the magician at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The student council president can deputise for the principal in important meetings.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to deputise for the lead role due to illness, and he did a great job.
